title: Senior React Native Engineer
description:
**Northmill Bank is a Swedish fintech company dedicated to revolutionizing the way we manage and protect our finances. We're creating a different kind of banking experience — digital yet personal.**


Founded in 2006, Northmill has grown to over 200 employees across 3 countries, 2,500 merchants, and 600,000 users. We use the latest technology to build secure, smart, and user-friendly products for both consumers and businesses. Our customers are the reason we do what we do. We're a 100% cloud-based product company where technology drives everything we build.


Take the chance to be a part of us and our journey!

  

**About the role:**


As a **Senior React Native Engineer**, you’ll join a cross-functional product team and play a key role in shaping and building our mobile and web banking applications. You’ll work hands-on with **React Native**, **React.js**, and **TypeScript**, contributing to both the technical foundation and the user experience of our products.


You’ll help build customer-facing features for digital banking — including payments, credit, and personal finance tools — all designed to improve financial wellbeing.


You’ll work closely with backend developers, designers, and product managers to bring new features to life — always with performance, security, and usability in mind. You’ll also help guide architectural decisions and continuously improve our ways of working.


You’ll be based in **Stockholm**, working alongside a local and international team, including our Engineering Center in **Katowice, Poland**.

 **Your background:**

* + Solid experience in building **mobile and/or web applications**
	+ Strong skills in **React Native** (CLI or Expo) and **TypeScript**
	+ Experience with **React.js** and building component-based UIs
	+ Familiar with **web services and APIs**
	+ Comfortable using modern dev practices (code reviews, CI/CD, testing)
	+ Exposure to **Agile** workflows
  

  

You are a **creative and curious person** with a genuine interest in software development. You’re excited about exploring new technologies and trends, and you enjoy sharing knowledge with your team.


Like us, you probably love writing clean, high-quality code — and you're not afraid to flag issues or suggest better solutions. You're a true team player who thrives in a collaborative, agile environment.

 **Bonus points if you also have:**

* Experience with native **Android and/or iOS** development
* A degree in **Computer Science**, Engineering, or a related field
* Backend experience NestJS, GraphQL and familiar with Accessibility (a11y)

 **What we offer:**

  

* A key role in a **product-first**, cloud-native tech company
* The chance to shape both **technical architecture** and **product direction**
* A modern office in the heart of **Stockholm**, with a rooftop terrace and stunning views
* Collaboration with talented, humble colleagues in a flat organization
* Competitive compensation and benefits
* Support for your learning and development
* An open, friendly culture that values ideas over titles

 **Fun Facts:**

* + Daily **breakfast**, fresh fruit, and our sacred **Friday fika**
	+ Generous **wellness allowance** and regular visits from a massage therapist
	+ A treadmill in one of our conference rooms (yes, really!)
	+ Legendary **“Northchill” afterworks** and **“Northcon”** – our own internal conference (often held abroad)
	+ Celebrated team wins, product launches, and milestones together
	+ A team-first, non-corporate culture with space for big ideas and small rituals

 **Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**

title: Team Manager - Information Management
description:
**T E A M M A N A G E R**  

*Information Management*  

**\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**  

Full-time | Permanent | Göteborg/Malmö  

  

***DISCLAIMER: Please*** ***do not apply*** ***if you do not speak Swedish. T******his is a hard requirement for this position - thank you!***  



  

**A B O U T X E N I T**  

Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and modern work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers.  

Xenit is **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft. *(A large portion of this achievement can be attributed to the work of engineers within our Modern Work department and their focus on Microsoft Copilot)*
  

  

**W H A T W E N E E D**  

Xenit's Modern Work business area consists of three separate teams: **Collaboration**, **Endpoint** and **Information Management**. As the business area continues to grow successfully, we are looking for a talented Information Management Specialist who will take on both *technical* and *operational* responsibility for the IM Team.  

We're looking for someone who comes from a background as a technical consultant, who has either recently begun their leadership journey, or would like to do so now.
  

  

The split of management vs. technical delivery is **50/50%** for this position and so although managing your team will take up a fair portion of your work, you will still be expected to work as a technical consultant - This is why we need someone who still has a foot into the technology, and really knows the ins and outs of the IM sphere  

  

  

  

**Examples of potential tasks:**  

* **Technical implementation**and/or Solutions Architecture within the IM sphere (very much dependent on skill level of chosen candidate).
* **Responsibility for resource planning:** Ensure optimal use of the teams competence into relevant assignments
* **Working closely with Business Area Manager on strategy,** and how best to implement for operational success.
* **1 to 1s** with your team members
* **Salary reviews/negotiations** each year
* **Recruitment:** Deciding on needs, working closely with our Head of Talent in the recruitment process, interviewing candidates, job offering
* **Pre-sale Engineering:** Providing technical guidance to both business area managers and sales teams in customer discussions

  

**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**  

**We believe our next Team Manager has:**  

* **6****+ years** within the Information Management sphere **(M365, SharePoint, ECM, Cloud Development, Information Architecture, Information Security)**
* Previous consulting work and good experience with a variety of customers
* Experience with pre-sale, governance & strategy
* A confident, senior presence in general

  

**It is a bonus if you have:**  

* Any previous management/team leading experience (with positive results, of course!)
* A good network of loyal and satisfied customers
 **We also believe that you are a person who:**  

* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes **responsibility** for their work
* Wants to get the best out of their team, and focuses on team career development and satisfaction
* Is **available** and **present** for their team members when needed


- Has good communication skills - is open, transparent and direct in their instruction  

* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish AND English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do

  

  

**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**  

**Benefits**  

Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.  

  

**Activities**  

Each quarter, we host **Xenit Inspire** where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation (workshops and hackathons). Once a year, we host **Women Inspire** at our office, in which we hold presentations from different women within the tech industry.  

We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.
  

  

Last year, Xenit was awarded **"Career Company of 2024"**. This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*  

**Read more about Karriar Företagen** **here****.**

title: Voice of the Customer Analyst
description:
We're looking for a Voice of the Customer Analyst with strong communication skills and an analytical mindset to join the Avinode team in Sweden. You will have the flexibility to work from the Gothenburg office or remotely, whichever suits you best. Your addition to the team will bring valuable analytics and insights in regards to CX on all Avinode platforms - Avinode Marketplace, Schedaero and Paynode.


This role goes beyond reporting: you'll proactively connect the dots between data, business goals, and customer experience across three main platforms: Avinode Marketplace, Schedaero, and Paynode.


You'll help Avinode understand how users interact with their platforms, what they need, what they're frustrated with, and how they can turn those insights into tangible improvements, not just internally, but across their go-to-market and product strategy. We are leaning more on the communicative side this time around, where we expect you to be comfortable in explaining insights, nudging change, and pushing discussions forward — not just deep-diving into data.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Drive insights from customer data across the journey - focus initially on the early stages of the customer journey (e.g. sales experience, onboarding, website feedback).
* Present insights proactively – not just when asked, but before the questions come. You'll connect the dots between NPS, churn and user behavior to then drive change.
* Build on what exists – A solid feedback structure has been put in place. We now need to scale it, especially around surveys and touchpoints.
* Own survey quality and automation – we’re behind on this. You’ll help us catch up.
* Lead VOC tooling initiatives – drive adoption, optimization, and continued evolution of our customer feedback management tool.
* Work cross-functionally – partner with Product, CX, Sales, and Support to connect insights to action.

**Ideal candidate**
-------------------

* Experience working in a digital/SaaS company
* 4+ years' of experience in a similar role
* Experience of working in Power BI and with data. SQL knowledge is a big plus
* Great with analytics - capable of understanding and analyzing metrics in order to turn these into valuable insights
* Communicating fluently in English - written and spoken


To become a "Noder" you have to be flexible and able to handle ambiguity. You can produce high quality deliverables in support of customer experience excellence and retention while also defining product ROI for clients and presenting this with the help of great communication abilities.

**What does Avinode offer you?**

* We are proud to offer you a workplace where we have high engagement and where creativity and curiosity is always much appreciated. Your ideas will be heard.
* Ability to schedule your calendar with flexible work locations.
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Synergy events where all Noders across meet each other to collaborate on a professional level as well as having fun which is equally as important.
* Great opportunities to develop certain skill or to learn new things with trainings. We want to support your development and dreams.

**About Avinode Group**
-----------------------


Avinode Group offers a fully connected suite of essential B2B software to enable Business Aviation professionals through the entire workflow of managing, sourcing, and booking aircraft. Founded in the heart of Sweden in 2002, we support around 2,000 companies globally.


Our essential tools are designed to minimize stress and maximize profit for brokers and operators. The suite includes the world’s leading sourcing platform for air charter, making it easy to find aircraft, book trips, and market aircraft globally. Air charter operators and flight departments are provided with a fully cloud-based fleet management system to make flight operations smoother. Our customers can rely on a hassle-free process from quoting to booking and paying with a fully integrated payment solution.


With 150+ Noders spread between Sweden and the US, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers everyone to come forward with new ideas, try them out, make some mistakes, and initiate dialogue. Avinode Group seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work alongside other intelligent, humorous, and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us daily to exceed expectations.


Avinode Group is owned by CAMP Systems, which is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.


Want more details? Discover the value our essentials bring to our customers every day https://avinodegroup.com/

title: Senior Product Manager - Data
description:
We’re hiring a **Senior Product Manager – Data** to lead how Avinode develops data products that enable data-informed decisions across the business and power smarter, data-driven experiences for our customers. Over the past two years, we’ve laid the foundation for a modern data platform, built on Databricks, and are now ready to scale it.


In this role, you will shape our data product strategy, align it with company and product goals and lead the direction of our data team. You’ll work closely with engineers, analysts, product managers, and senior stakeholders not just to deliver data capabilities, but to influence how we organize and invest in data across the company. As a Senior Data Product Manager, you’ll raise the bar for how we think about data, bringing experience, perspective, and a strong product voice to the table. You’ll be at the intersection of product and platform, driving the use of data in customer-facing features like recommendations, automation, and predictive workflows, to create an intelligent experience that guides users to the right outcome at the right time.


You will be a part of a warm, inclusive, and supportive workplace, where a bit of quirky humor is always welcome. Are you up for this exciting challenge?

**Location:** Gothenburg, Sweden or Remote in Sweden.

**What you will be doing**


We expect our product teams to take full ownership of their product and empower them to take decisions that result in products that delight our customers and work for our business. As a Senior Product Manager who has been there and done that, you will be a leader in elevating product mindset across the organisation, as well as a mentor to your fellow Product Managers. With a global product and offices in Sweden and the US, communication is vital. Your ability to run meetings and workshops with both physical and digital participants will be greatly appreciated.

* Own the strategy and roadmap for our internal data platform and products, grounded in business needs and aligned with company and product goals
* Set clear direction and priorities for the data team to scale our platform and unlock business value
* Drive delivery of platform capabilities, integrations and improvements together with your team
* Identify opportunities in collaboration with stakeholders, turning data into scalable solutions that deliver customer and business value
* Shape how we organize around data, informing tooling choices, governance models, and how data is used across teams
* Drive smarter, guided customer experiences by providing the right data capabilities and infrastructure
* Advance our ability to support machine learning and AI use cases
* Expand how we capture and connect data from our own products and external sources to close gaps and support broader use cases

**What you will bring along**


You have worked as a Product Manager on data products at a SaaS company; even better if that was a B2B product. You are deeply familiar with modern data architecture, pipelines and tooling. You are comfortable in the face of ambiguity, and know how to test and evaluate to find a great solution without knowing what is right. You are an excellent problem solver and love being creative in your everyday work. Your positive energy is contagious! You know how to combine data, intuition, and deep empathy for the user.

* 5+ years of Product Management in a software company, ideally focused on data products, platforms or internal tooling
* Strong understanding of modern data architecture, pipelines, and tooling. We use Databricks and Azure, but experience with any modern stack is welcome
* You are an excellent communicator and you are fluent in English. We don’t require any Swedish language competence, as English is our corporate language.
* Strong stakeholder management skills. You understand the needs of the business as well as the needs of your customers, and are skilled in having tough conversations about competing priorities and finding win-win solutions. Confidence and credibility in working with senior stakeholders to shape strategic direction around data use
* Skilled at leading technical delivery through clear prioritization, structured thinking, and collaboration
* Confident working with SQL and reasoning about data models
* Familiarity with how data powers machine learning use cases is a plus
* Experience working in a distributed, remote-first team environment

**What do we offer you?**


This role is a chance to drive change across the business aviation industry. That change won’t happen by accident. Business aviation generates mountains of data, but much of it remains underused. At Avinode, we’re working to change that. By turning raw data into actionable insights our customers can rely on to grow and optimize their operations. This role will help the industry turn its data into real impact.


We are passionate about our work and proud of our high engagement, creativity, and curious culture. But don't worry, we like to laugh and have fun.


We are a fully remote company. You decide where and how you work. We want you to love what you do, but we know we all need to live, so we provide a competitive salary and a set of benefits.

**Want to join our crew?**


Sounds like a great fit for you? You’ll find more fun facts about our Noders (that’s what we call ourselves) and our culture on our website. Kindly apply for this position through the “apply” button. We are not able to accept applications via email. Please note that selections will be running continuously, so don’t wait to apply!

**About Avinode Group**


Avinode Group offers a fully connected suite of essential B2B software to enable Business Aviation professionals through the entire workflow of managing, sourcing, and booking aircraft. Founded in the heart of Sweden in 2002, we support around 2,000 companies globally.


Our essential tools are designed to minimize stress and maximize profit for brokers and operators. The suite includes the world’s leading sourcing platform for air charter, making it easy to find aircraft, book trips, and market aircraft globally. Air charter operators and flight departments are provided with a fully cloud-based fleet management system to make flight operations smoother. Our customers can rely on a hassle-free process from quoting to booking and paying with a fully integrated payment solution.


With 150+ Noders spread between Sweden and the US, our flexible and collaborative culture empowers everyone to come forward with new ideas, try them out, make some mistakes, and initiate dialogue. Avinode Group seeks candidates who thrive on exciting assignments and can collaboratively work alongside other intelligent, humorous, and dedicated co-workers. Our roots are firmly planted in our core values, which inspire us daily to exceed expectations.


Avinode Group is owned by CAMP Systems, which is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry.


We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.


Want more details? Discover the value our essentials bring to our customers every day https://avinodegroup.com/

title: Platform Specialist
description:
**Platform Specialist - Microsoft Fabric** 




  





 We are seeking an experienced
 **Platform Specialist** 
 with a focus on
 **Microsoft Fabric** 
 to strengthen the platform team.
 



  





**Assignment Description** 




  





 The platform team is responsible for a cloud-based data and analytics platform in Azure, with key services like Azure Databricks and Microsoft Fabric. The team's mission is to enable other development teams to easily set up, maintain, and expand data, analytics, and AI capabilities on the platform.
 



 In this role, you will help create a robust, user-friendly, and secure platform. You will specifically work on the establishment and management of Microsoft Fabric, and ensure that tenant administration and the onboarding of new teams are done in an efficient and controlled manner.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Establish and further develop the platform's services, focusing on Microsoft Fabric and Azure Databricks.
* Ensure the platform is easy to use and that new teams can get started quickly.
* Support and train development teams on how to best use the platform's services.
* Design and implement processes for tenant administration, access management, and governance in Microsoft Fabric.
* Contribute to the platform's strategy, security, and cost control.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Experience working with cloud-based data and analytics platforms, preferably in Azure.
* Deep understanding of Microsoft Fabric, including tenant administration, security, and access management.
* Experience with Azure Databricks and related services.
* Good understanding of platform management, onboarding, and support for development teams.
* Knowledge of data governance, security, and compliance in a cloud environment.
* Experience with automation, CI/CD, and Infrastructure as Code in Azure is a plus.



  





**Personal Attributes** 




  




* Structured, self-sufficient, and solution-oriented.
* Strong teaching skills and a service-oriented mindset.
* Enjoys collaboration and knowledge sharing.
* Good knowledge of Swedish, both written and spoken, is a requirement.

title: Senior Solutions Consultant - Supply Chain
description:
At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators focused on optimizing business decision-making through our leading AI-infused scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market.
   

  

 What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers’ success and to our Winning Culture.
   

  

 Our customers rank among the who’s who in the Fortune 50. Coca-Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies who rely on our best-in-class platform.
   

  

 Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals, and we love celebrating our wins – big and small.
   

  

 Supported by operating principles of being strategy-led, values-based and disciplined in execution, you’ll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and let’s build what’s next - together!
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic
 **Presales** 
**Supply Chain Solutions Consultant** 
 with experience in the manufacturing or retail sectors. In this role, you will leverage Anaplan's platform to design and present tailored supply chain solutions, addressing the unique challenges of major enterprise customers.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Client Engagement: Collaborate with large enterprise prospects to identify inefficiencies in their supply chain processes. Demonstrate how Anaplan's solutions can effectively address these challenges, driving significant improvements.
* Solution Development: Design and deliver customized, domain-specific demonstrations and proof-of-concept models that directly address client pain points.
* Technical Expertise: Utilize your deep understanding of supply chain processes to showcase the capabilities of Anaplan's platform, ensuring alignment with client needs and business objectives.
* Collaboration: Work closely with sales, product development, and implementation teams to ensure seamless integration of proposed solutions into clients' operations.
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices to provide innovative solutions and maintain a competitive edge in the market.


**Your Qualifications**
* Experience: Pre-sales experience in supply chain management within the manufacturing or retail industries. Prior experience with enterprise planning management (EPM) or business process management (BPM) solutions is advantageous.
* Technical Proficiency: Strong understanding of supply chain processes, including demand planning, supply planning, inventory management, and production planning. Experience with multi-dimensional modeling, business intelligence, or analytics is a plus.
* Communication Skills: Exceptional presentation and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Problem-Solving Ability: Proven track record of analyzing complex client problems and developing tailored solutions that drive business value.
* Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, quickly learn new technologies, and adapt to changing client needs.
* Travel Requirement: Willingness and ability to travel approximately 50% of the time within the EMEA region to engage with clients and support sales activities.


**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB)**
 We believe attracting and retaining the best talent and fostering an inclusive culture strengthens our business. DEIB improves our workforce, enhances trust with our partners and customers, and drives business success. Build your career in a place where diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging aren’t just words on paper – this is what drives our innovation, it’s how we connect, and it contributes to what makes us a market leader. We believe in a hiring and working environment where all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day!
   

  

 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer** 
  

  

 It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondence, claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals.
   

  

 Anaplan does not:
   

  

* Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.
* Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible and then followed up via written communication.


 All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Anaplan, please send an email to people@anaplan.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.

title: Junior DevSecOps
description:
**Job Description**
 Junior DevSecOps
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 This role offers the rare opportunity to step into the heart of a cloud-native fintech environment, where you won’t just be monitoring dashboards but actively shaping the security of modern and resillient Java/Spring Boot microservices and TypeScript/React frontends stack, deployed on AWS and on-prem. You’ll be embedded in a collaborative culture over multiple geographies where security is a shared responsibility across development, cloud, and product teams. You will also have the space to grow beyond triage work and gain hands-on exposure to both application security and cloud infrastructure security, all while building expertise in an industry where trust and compliance are mission-critical.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
* Monitor and analyze security alerts across cloud services (AWS + on-prem) and applications.
* Assist with incident response: investigating, documenting, and helping remediate security events.
* Work closely with developers to secure Spring Boot microservices and APIs.
* Run vulnerability scans and support remediation of findings across code and infrastructure.
* Help strengthen cloud security.
* Stay ahead of and share the latest threats, cloud risks, and fintech security trends.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
   

  

* You can demonstrate a solid understanding of IT fundamentals (networking, operating systems, cloud basics).
* You’ve got substantial knowledge of AWS cloud services (App Runner, Fargate, Cognito, RDS etc.) and cloud security principles.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across security, backend (Java/Spring Boot), and frontend (TypeScript/React) teams.
* Motivation and passion for cybersecurity, cloud-native applications, and fintech innovation.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
* You master the fundamentals of Java/Spring Boot applications and React/TypeScript frontends, including common application security risks (OWASP Top 10).
* 2+ years working in security operations, cloud security, DevSecOps, or related IT/security engineering roles.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also get:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Strategic Account Manager
description:
Do you want to work at the heart of digital commerce, building long-term partnerships with some of the Nordic region’s most ambitious retailers, brands and B2B companies? We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager who combines strong commercial drive with strategic insight to nurture existing customer relationships and proactively grow revenue.
 



  





 As a 
 **Strategic Account Manager** 
  at Norce, you will own a portfolio of our most important customers, securing retention and driving Net Revenue Retention (NRR) by identifying growth opportunities and collaborating closely with our solution partners to deliver added value. Your mission is to create value for both the customer and Norce by strengthening relationships, uncovering commercial opportunities, and leading initiatives that generate measurable business impact. You will work closely with senior stakeholders, solution partners, and internal teams to build lasting partnerships and support customers as their needs and ambitions evolve.
 



  





 We believe in building partnerships that last. That means understanding your customers’ business inside and out – their strategy, goals, and challenges – and proactively helping them succeed. Your efforts will directly influence the profitability, retention, and expansion of our customer base.
 



  





**This role suits you if you:** 



* Enjoy combining strategic planning with hands-on business development.
* Are confident engaging and negotiating with senior decision-makers, including C-level executives.
* Can see both the big picture and the details needed to make it happen.
* Thrive when collaborating across teams and with external partners.
* Are motivated by achieving results through a strong business mindset, focused on maximizing customer value and retention.



  





**Experience we believe will help you succeed:** 



* 5+ years of experience in B2B sales, strategic account management, or customer success –preferably within SaaS, technology, or other complex, solution-based industries.
* Proven success managing and growing large strategic accounts, securing long-term partnerships, and driving profitable growth.
* Strong track record in leading contract negotiations and renewals that deliver solid commercial results.
* Experience working within the ecommerce sector and collaborating closely with solution partners to deliver the best possible value to customers.
* Solid technical understanding with the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and with business impact.



  





**Workplace** 
 : You can be based at either our Gothenburg or Stockholm office.
 



  





**About Norce** 




 Norce is the Nordic region’s leading SaaS platform for digital commerce. We empower B2B and B2C companies with powerful technology to accelerate their digital business. Our expertise lies in managing large and complex assortments, optimising pricing & campaigns, and delivering powerful B2B functionality. We meet the most advanced needs for security, flexibility, and scalability through an architecture that is True SaaS, API-first, headless, and composable. Norce Commerce is today trusted by some of the Nordic region’s most successful companies including Adlibris, Blåkläder, Cervera, Royal Design, and Spendrups. Our offices are located in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Oslo where our teams of dedicated experts work with one common objective, creating superior value for our customers and partners. For more information, visit www.norce.io or follow us on LinkedIn.

title: Senior Sales Director
description:
🧰 Who We Are
   

  

 Wakam is a B2B2C insurance company that creates white-label insurance solutions via its Play&Plug® technology platform for more than 80 partners. We provide most of our insurance products through API, and hosts white label insurance solutions via our Play&Plug technology platform.
   

  

 With a footprint spanning 32 countries mostly generated outside France, Wakam is the European leader in digital and embedded insurance.
   

  

 Strongly committed to social responsibility,
 **Wakam is a mission-driven company** 
 dedicated to "enabling transparent and impactful insurance".
   

  

 🚀
 **About the Team**
 The
 **Revenue Office** 
 is at the forefront of Wakam's
 **European growth strategy** 
 . Our mission is to expand our footprint across key markets by forging
 **high-impact partnerships** 
 with MGAs, brokers, fintechs, insurtechs, retailers, and marketplaces.
   

  

 We operate in
 **32 countries** 
 , and our commercial team reflects that diversity — agile, collaborative, and driven by
 **performance and local market insight** 
 .
   

  

 At Wakam,
 **ambition, autonomy, and impact** 
 aren't just encouraged — they're expected and celebrated.
   

  

 🎯
 **Your Mission**
 As
 **Senior Sales Director** 
 , your mission is to
 **accelerate Wakam's growth across key European markets** 
 , with a focus on regions where we aim to strengthen our presence —
 **Southern, Central, or Western Europe** 
 , depending on your location and expertise.
   

  

 You will identify and close high-value
 **distribution partnerships** 
 , particularly with brokers, MGAs, fintechs, insurtechs, retailers, and digital marketplaces. You'll represent Wakam's modern vision of embedded and B2B2C insurance — and be the
 **local face of our "fast-to-market" promise** 
 .
   

  

 Your key responsibilities:
   

  

* Drive Market Growth: Own business development across your designated European region. Identify leads, close strategic deals, and grow key partnerships.
* Build Trusted Partnerships: Understand your partners' ecosystems and craft tailored insurance solutions that meet their operational models and customer needs.
* Collaborate Internally: Partner with Underwriting, Pricing, and Delivery teams to co-build and launch new products at speed.
* Ensure Profitability: Align every deal with Wakam's risk appetite and long-term business objectives — we prioritize quality and margin over volume.
* Be Wakam's Commercial Voice Locally: Represent the brand at industry events, pitch confidently, and strengthen our visibility as a tech-forward insurer.
* Leverage Innovation: Be AI-curious. Use CRM systems, automation, and AI tools to streamline your lead pipeline and optimize commercial effectiveness.


 🧠
 **What You Bring**
* 8+ years of experience in commercial or business development roles, including 3+ years in insurance (brokerage, MGA, insurtech, fintech, or embedded insurance).
* Deep knowledge of B2B2C or embedded insurance distribution models in a European context.
* Proven track record of closing complex, multi-stakeholder deals.
* Fluency in English is mandatory; fluency in an additional European language (e.g., French, Spanish, Italian, or German) is a strong asset.
* Strong skills in negotiation, relationship management, and pitching.
* Commercial acumen with a data- and profitability-driven mindset.
* Interest in AI tools, automation, and CRM/data platforms.


 ✨
 **Who You Are**
* You're a strategic closer who thrives in high-autonomy roles.
* You love working across fast-paced, multicultural teams.
* You're tech-savvy, curious, and open to reinventing how insurance is sold.
* You want your commercial voice to shape the future of the company.
* You care about impact, transparency, and being part of a mission-led scale-up.


 🌟
 **Why Join Wakam?**
* 🚀 Speed-to-Market: From terms to launch, we move fast — 30 days for pricing, 90 days to go live.
* 📊 Transparency: We provide full visibility on performance and share profits from day one.
* 🤝 Autonomy & Ownership: You own your market(s) and directly impact our revenue growth.
* 💡 Tech-Forward Culture: Leverage AI and automation tools to sell smarter.
* 🌍 European Scale: Collaborate with underwriting, delivery, and tech teams across the continent.
* 🏡 Flexibility: Remote-first culture and performance-based compensation.


 🏆
 **Hiring Process**
* Screening Interview – with our Talent Acquisition Partner
* Interview with our CEO
* Interview with our Chief Underwriting Officer (CUO)
* Final Interview – with our VP People and selected executives


**Recruitment Agencies:**
**Wakam has an in-house recruitment team** 
 , which focuses on sourcing great candidates directly.
 **Wakam does not accept unsolicited resumes from agency or search firm recruiters** 
 .
   

  

**Fees will not be paid** 
 in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired. When we do use agencies, we have a PSL in place, so
 **please do not contact our managers directly** 
 .
   

  

**More About Us**
 Check out our website to learn about the 11 cultural markers that make Wakam truly special! If you're adventurous, impact-driven, and ready to shape the future of insurance, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**💫 What Makes Us Unique:**
* True remote work flexibility with our Wakam From Anywhere (WFA) program - yes, we even have a teammate working from a sailboat! ⛵
* Flat hierarchical system promoting direct impact and autonomy 🚀
* Monthly Free.day: dedicated time for personal growth and skills development 📚
* Lunch voucher with Swile card
* A meaningful company: we became a Mission-driven company in March 2021
* Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.


 At Wakam, our "Free to Impact" culture is built on four essential pillars that shape everything we do :
   

  

 🗣️
 **Communication & Knowledge Management**
* Foster transparent collaboration across our flat organizational structure
* Share knowledge freely in our highly collaborative environment
* Contribute to our collective intelligence through open dialogue


 🔍
 **Curiosity**
* Embrace our monthly Free.day for learning and skills sponsorship
* Think big and challenge conventional insurance norms
* Stay eager to learn and explore new possibilities


 🔄
 **Continuous Improvement**
* Take initiative to transform the insurance industry
* Turn challenges into opportunities for innovation
* Constantly evolve our ways of working


 🎯
 **Outcome Oriented**
* Focus on impact rather than hierarchy
* Drive results through clear objectives and autonomy
* Transform bold ideas into concrete solutions


***At Wakam, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please feel free to reach out to your recruiter.***

title: Business Development Representative
description:
**Business Development Representative** 




**Grow your sales career – and beyond.** 




  





 At Vibrance, we help ambitious tech and SaaS companies grow through strategy, commercial development, and the right talent in place. Now we’re looking for a Business Development Representative who wants to take the next step: from driving sales growth to evolving into a broader management consulting role within commercial growth.
 



  





**The Role** 




  





 As a BDR at Vibrance, you’ll be a key player in our growth team. Your work will include:
 



  




* Prospecting and analyzing potential clients



  




* Designing and executing multi-channel outreach campaigns (email, LinkedIn, phone)



  




* Booking meetings and building relationships with C-level decision-makers



  




* Participating in customer meetings, intro pitches, and discovery calls



  




* Working in CRM and supporting sales operations



  




* Learning our frameworks for commercial growth and scalable sales structures



  





 In parallel, you’ll gain exposure to our consulting projects—learning first-hand how we help founders, executives, and revenue teams accelerate growth. The goal: to develop you into a 360° consultant, combining sales, strategy, and business development.
 



  





**Who You Are** 




  





 We’re looking for someone with a proven foundation in sales who’s ready to grow further. You have:
 



  




* 3–5 years of experience as an SDR, BDR, or AE



  




* Preferably experience from SaaS or recruitment



  




* Strong track record of booking meetings with C-level decision-makers (highly valued)



  




* Fluency in both Swedish and English (mandatory)



  




* A university degree and/or military service (meritorious)



  





**On a personal level, you are:** 




  




* Driven, curious, and eager to understand both people and business



  




* Confident and straightforward in your communication—you’re not afraid to pick up the phone



  




* Structured in your work but flexible in your thinking



  




* Ambitious and motivated by long-term growth and responsibility



  





**Why Vibrance?** 




  





 We’re not a traditional consultancy firm. We’re building the next leading company in commercial growth. Here’s what you’ll get:
 



  




* Work closely with senior leaders who have been CEOs, CROs, Sales Directors, and entrepreneurs



  




* Direct coaching from people who have built and scaled companies from the ground up



  




* A unique career path: from pre-sales to becoming a 360° management consultant in commercial development



  




* The chance to influence, shape processes, and grow with Vibrance from the start



  





**Application** 




  





 Ready to take the next step in your career and grow with Vibrance?
 



  





 Questions? Reach us at info@vibrance.se.
 



 Learn more at www.vibrance.se or on our LinkedIn page.

title: Digital Account Executive (Marketing, Commerce & Data Cloud)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Sales
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

 Our Digital Account Executives engage with a mix of existing customers and new leads to sell our digital platforms including Marketing Cloud, Commerce Cloud and Data Cloud. They build positive, trusted relationships with both key team members and c-suite decision makers within their patch, and become natural at helping customers realise value from their Salesforce investments. You will use your skills to develop opportunities through whitespace prospecting.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Manage a defined set of enterprise accounts in Sweden, driving adoption and growth of Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Commerce Cloud and Data Cloud solutions.
* Lead end-to-end sales cycles, engaging with CMOs, CDOs, and other senior decision-makers to align Salesforce solutions with customer challenges.
* Act as a trusted advisor, understanding customer needs and aligning them with Salesforce capabilities to deliver measurable business outcomes.
* Share Salesforce value proposition for existing and/or new customers
* Work closely with Solution Engineers, Customer Success teams, and Product specialists to craft tailored solutions and ensure customer success.
* Meet or exceed revenue targets and performance metrics consistently.


**Required Qualifications**
* A seasoned Enterprise Account Executive with a strong track record in digital marketing, ecommerce, or cloud-based solutions.
* Thrive in a dynamic, high-performance environment where learning and growth are paramount.
* Ability to navigate complex sales environments and deliver compelling ROI-based proposals.
* Enthusiasm for technology and innovation, from marketing strategies to digital commerce architecture.
* Collaborative mindset with a passion for working in a fast-paced, evolving team environment.


**Benefits & Perks**
 Check out our benefits site which explains our various benefits, including well-being reimbursement, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more
   

  

 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Konsult inom Informations-/datadriven vård
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vi söker konsulter med specialisering inom informations-/datadrivet beslutsfattande till vårt snabbt växande e-Hälsoteam. Du månar om vården och ser möjligheterna med digitalisering och särskilt informations-/ datadrivet beslutsfattande. Du kommer att arbeta inom någon eller flera aspekter som: ledning och styrning, verksamhetsutveckling, lösningsdesign och integration, datagovernance och juridik. Dina erfarenheter och drivkrafter: Du har tidigare arbetat med business intelligence och datadriven utveckling inom region och/eller kommun.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av AI-lösningar är meriterande.
   

  

 Du uppskattar att lära nytt, lösa problem och att dela dig med dig av den kunskap du har. Du är flexibel och ansvarstagande. Med flera års erfarenhet inom business intelligence och informationsdrivna arbetssätt inom region och kommun så har du den grund som behövs för att ta dig an arbetet i de uppdrag vi utför.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av ett multidisciplinärt specialistteam inom hälsa, vård och omsorg på ca. 40 medarbetare. Den övergripande uppgiften är att säkerställa att våra kunder kan realisera förväntade nyttor via strategi-, design- och förändringsarbete. Vi arbetar såväl enskilt som tillsammans med kollegor i våra projekt. Våra uppdrag genomförs med stöd av etablerade metoder och modeller som baseras på branschstandarder. Som konsult inom det nationella e-hälsoteamet, kommer du att ansvara för att CGIs leverans skapar mervärde för kunden, bibehålla goda kundrelationer samt bidra till ett gott samarbetsklimat internt och till vår gemensamma framgång. I den här rollen kommer du specifikt att bidra med förutsättningar för att informationsdrivet arbetssätt genomsyrar kundorganisationerna, och möjliggöra AI-tillämpningar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Grundkrav Vi accepterar bara ansökningar på svenska. We only accept applications in Swedish. Erfarenhet av svensk sjukvård är ett absolut krav. A mandatory requirement is work experience from the Swedish healthcare system. God förståelse av nationell/regional vårdstruktur och etablerade standarder som HL7 och FHIR. Förstålse och intresse för att utveckla vården mha AI. Resor ingår i tjänsten / Travel is part of the job. Vi söker personer som kan axla följande uppgifter/områden
   

  

* Implementera informations-/datadrivet arbetssätt
* Leda utveckling
* Agera Kravställare
* Implementera och integrera BI-system
* Leda och utföra test och validering
* Data governance, exempelvis datakvalitet, masterdata
* Arbete som arkitekt inom integration och lösning


 Placeringsort:
   

  

 Göteborg, Stockholm eller Malmö
   

  

 Arbetsmiljö och sammanhang:
   

  

 Vi på CGI tror att vi når längre om vi trivs ihop och jobbar tillsammans. Varje dag stöttar vi varandra, våra kunder och bygger framtiden tillsammans. I det nationella e-hälsoteamet drivs vi av visionen att hjälpa offentlig och privat hälsa, vård och omsorg för att skapa bättre utfall för både individen och organisationen. Därutöver vill vi bidra till en positiv samhällsutveckling genom att vara en komplett partner så att Sverige på bästa sätt tillvaratar digitaliseringens möjligheter.
   

  

 Digitaliseringen inom vård, hälsa och omsorg ger enorma möjligheter men tekniken måste anpassas till de sammanhang där den ska göra nytta. Tillsammans med våra partners stöttar vi våra kunder med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och tjänster inom bland annat avancerad medicinsk bilddiagnostik, smarta sjukhus, datadriven sjukvård och AI.
   

  

 Övrigt om rollen
   

  

 Resor ingår i rollen, även om väldigt stor del av verksamheten numera sker digitalt. Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

 Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?
   

  

 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om några av våra förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Om du undrar över något, skicka gärna dina funderingar till Fredrik Augustsson. Fredrik.Augustsson@cgi.com
   

  

 Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Security Operations Specialist – Flexible Hybrid Role
description:
Our client, a high-impact international biopharma company, is on the lookout for a Security Operations Specialist to join their team in Stockholm. In this role, you’ll be at the forefront of safeguarding their operations, ensuring the security of sensitive data, and playing a key role in their mission to improve lives with innovative solutions. Known for their commitment to professional growth, inclusion, and fostering a healthy work-life balance, they offer a nurturing environment for people who enjoy autonomy while collaborating across departments.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Enjoy remote work flexibility with the option to work from home 2 days a week post-onboarding.
* Engage in a fast-paced, challenging SOC environment that values your quick decision-making skills.
* Collaborate with skilled professionals in a supportive setting that encourages ongoing learning and growth.


**Role Responsibilities:**
* Monitor and respond to security incidents, aligning with the company’s mission to ensure robust IT security measures.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement security protocols, enhancing overall system protection.
* Utilize your skills in endpoint and email security management to safeguard the organization’s infrastructural integrity.


**Requirements:**
* 4+ years of proven experience in IT security operations work.
* Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Strong knowledge of IT security, networks, and cybersecurity principles
* Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
* Experience with Microsoft Defender, SASE (SSE), and Azure is highly beneficial.


 If this job appeals to you please apply here or send your CV to me, Arianna Coia, on the NonStop Consulting website or on my Linkedin. If you are not available but you know someone that would be interested, please forward this to them and help the people in your network.
   

  

 Do you have any disability or condition that could affect you in the application and interview process? Please feel free to share this information as part of your application, including any necessary adjustments you might need, so we can help make the process easier for you. We assure you this information will not have any negative effect on the interview process outcome.
   

  

 About NonStop: We are NonStop, a leading provider of staffing solutions throughout Europe and now also in the US. We’re passionate about connecting talent with opportunity and work non-stop to support our clients in hiring the best talent for their teams. Feel free to pop over to our website, NonStop Consulting (https://www.nonstopconsulting.com), for more information, to browse all our roles, or to let us know how we can help you.

title: Microsoft 365 expert
description:
Vill du ta helhetsansvar för vår M365-miljö och driva den framåt? Vi söker en
 **Microsoft 365-expert** 
 till IT-teamet i Stockholm som kan omsätta teknik till affärsnytta i nära samarbete med verksamheten. Hos oss på BDO får du stort handlingsutrymme, skarpa kollegor och en kultur där utveckling prioriteras.
   

  

**Om oss**
 BDO är en heltäckande affärspartner till företag i deras vardag och på sin utvecklingsresa. Vi erbjuder tjänster inom revision, löneadministration, ekonomisk rådgivning och skatterådgivning. Här fortsätter vi nu att satsa mycket på vår tekniska utveckling för att möta branschens omställning. Vårt mål är att vara ledande på våra marknader och vi tror på att konkurrenskraften ligger i att vara i framkant kring den tekniska utvecklingen.
   

  

 Hos oss erbjuds du ett brett förmånspaket, hälsofrämjande aktiviteter, after work med mera, men kanske viktigast av allt → trevliga kollegor!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Microsoft 365-expert blir du en nyckelspelare i vår digitala arbetsplats. Du utvecklar, driver och förvaltar hela M365-miljön och utformar arkitekturen som gör vår IT både säker och modern. Du samarbetar tätt med våra interna team och i internationella forum, och har dialog med Microsofts egna experter när det behövs. Rollen passar dig som är en självgående doer som driver förändring och förbättringar, och som samtidigt är kommunikativ, serviceinriktad samt trygg i dialog med både slutanvändare och verksamhet.
   

  

**Dina ansvarsområden**
* Etablera affärseffektiva M365-lösningar för våra medarbetare.
* Löpande utvärdera M365- och Azure-portföljen och föreslå förbättringar.
* Bygga och förvalta vår M365-roadmap (utrullning av nya funktioner/produkter).
* Designa och implementera governance, säkerhet och efterlevnad enligt best practice.
* Administrera och dokumentera miljön (Entra ID/Azure AD, Intune/SCCM, Defender, Teams, SharePoint/OneDrive, Exchange Online, Office m.m.).
* Agera 3rd line för M365-incidenter och beställningar.
* Utbilda och stötta användare samt driva adoption i hela organisationen.
* Driva interna IT-projekt kopplade till IT-arbetsplats/M365


**Om dig**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet i en bred M365-roll (utveckling/förvaltning).
* Djup teknisk kunskap om M365:s förmågor, roadmap och hur tjänsterna samverkar.
* Förmåga att designa, utveckla och implementera lösningar i M365 (gärna med stöd av Power Platform).
* Bred plattformsförståelse: Teams, SharePoint/OneDrive, Exchange Online, Entra ID/Azure AD, Intune/SCCM, Defender, Compliance.


**Meriterande**
* Certifieringar såsom MS-100, MS-101, MS-102, MS-204.
* Erfarenhet av Power Platform (Power Apps/Automate/BI) och Azure-tjänster.
* Erfarenhet av governance, säkerhet/efterlevnad, samt PowerShell.
* Kunskap i Microsoft Purview.


**Vi erbjuder**
 Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat team med verkligt inflytande över teknikval, arkitektur och roadmap. Vi arbetar nära Microsofts ekosystem och erbjuder kompetensutveckling, flexibla villkor och en öppen, prestigelös kultur. Här får du långsiktigt forma vår M365-miljö, med stöd av härliga kollegor och en organisation som satsar på tech. Vi sitter i moderna och trevliga lokaler på Sveavägen i centrala Stockholm, med smidiga kommunikationer och bra gemensamma ytor.
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av oss?**
 Vad roligt! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt! Vid frågor kontakta ansvarig rekryterare: isabelle.norman@bdo.se

title: Delivery Consultant - Security, EMEA SE SDT
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking a skilled Delivery Consultant to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS).
   

  

 In this role, you'll work closely with customers to design, implement, and manage AWS solutions that meet their technical requirements and business objectives. You'll be a key player in driving customer success through their cloud journey, providing technical expertise and best practices throughout the project lifecycle.
   

  

 Possessing a deep understanding of AWS products and services, as a Delivery Consultant you will be proficient in architecting complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer. You’ll work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, assess current infrastructure, and propose effective migration strategies to AWS.
   

  

 As trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions, you will be responsible for leading the implementation process, ensuring adherence to best practices, optimizing performance, and managing risks throughout the project.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud.
   

  

 We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 AWS Global Services
   

  

 AWS Global Services includes experts from across AWS who help our customers design, build, operate, and secure their cloud environments. Customers innovate with AWS Professional Services, upskill with AWS Training and Certification, optimize with AWS Support and Managed Services, and meet objectives with AWS Security Assurance Services. Our expertise and emerging technologies include AWS Partners, AWS Sovereign Cloud, AWS International Product, and the Generative AI Innovation Center. You’ll join a diverse team of technical experts in dozens of countries who help customers achieve more with the AWS cloud.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing and implementing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions tailored to customer needs
* Providing technical guidance and troubleshooting support throughout project delivery
* Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and propose effective migration strategies
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 3+ Years experience in IT security, compliance and risk management, privacy & controls, and security reference architectures for all-in and/or hybrid deployments
* Hands-on technical expertise in building security capabilities in code and deploying infrastructure in code such as WAF, Firewall, Anti-DDOS, and SIEM
* 3+ Years hands-on technical expertise in security architecture, technology automation, implementation, integration, and/or deployment
* Experience running big scale security engagements with customers and ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services as needed
* Bachelor or Master degree in computer science or similar degree


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Scripting skills, i.e., PowerShell, Python, Node.js, Javascript, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc. as well with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments at scale
* Technical expertise (design and/or implementation) in Cloud Computing technologies
* Experience in leading customer facing engagements such as risk assessment and management audits and experience building enterprise security strategy for cloud adoption or driving the program's evolution to meet new requirements
* Understanding implications of meeting industry standards such as PCI DSS, ISO 27001, HIPAA, and NIST/DoD frameworks


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers.
